Parsing SCM output

nm.process.scm.Rd

Read and process SCM output file such that the output can be directly copied into Microsoft products and LaTeX typesetting.

nm.process.scm(path, ...)

Arguments

path

full directory path where scmlog files reside
...

ignored

Value

data.frame

Examples

library(encode)
library(magrittr)
library(dplyr)
library(knitr)
path = file.path(getOption("qpExampleDir"),"scm_example2")
nm.process.scm(path)
#>    step    model    ofvbase    ofvtest       dofv     goal deltadf significant     pvalue chosen direction

path %>%
  nm.process.scm %>%
  filter(chosen == 1) %>%                      # summary
  select(step, model, direction, pvalue) %>%
  formalize %>%                                # labels as colum names
  decode %>%                                   # substitute guide values 
  kable
#> 
#> 
#> | Step|Model    |Search Type | Test P-value|
#> |----:|:--------|:-----------|------------:|
#> |    1|CLGNDR-2 |Addition    |      0.0e+00|
#> |    2|CLAGE-5  |Addition    |      0.0e+00|
#> |    3|V1AGE-5  |Addition    |      0.0e+00|
#> |    4|V1GNDR-2 |Addition    |      1.2e-05|
 # model:
 path %>% nm.process.scm %>% filter(chosen == 1) %>%
 select(model)
#>      model
#> 1 CLGNDR-2
#> 2  CLAGE-5
#> 3  V1AGE-5
#> 4 V1GNDR-2
